title: Add auto-refresh countdown with visual indicator
description:
Implement auto-refresh with countdown timer for the Watchtower web UI.

**Requirements:**
- Configurable refresh interval (30s, 60s, 2m, 5m) via dropdown
- Circular progress indicator showing countdown (SVG ring)
- Countdown pauses on user interaction (hover/typing)
- Manual refresh button resets countdown
- 'Last updated X ago' timestamp in footer
- LocalStorage to persist user's interval preference

**Technical:**
- Pure JS, no external dependencies (HTMX already available)
- CSS animations for smooth countdown
- HTMX triggers for auto-refresh (hx-trigger='every Xs')

**Design:**
- Small circular indicator next to refresh button
- Subtle animation, not distracting
- Tooltip shows exact countdown

title: RE: Infisical secrets - use Machine Identity
description:
Velocity has Infisical Machine Identity configured. Use it to fetch secrets at runtime.

## How to Use

### 1. Update the cron job:

```bash
# In crontab -e:
0 5 * * * source ~/.infisical.env && cd /home/tanwa/vector/workout-tracker && infisical run --projectId=635f03f1-ff77-445d-b352-5f1cd1f53ecc --env=staging --path=/ -- ./workout_check.sh
```

### 2. Update slack_notify.sh to use environment variables:

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# Secrets injected by infisical run
CHANNEL="${SLACK_DM_TANWA}"  # or SLACK_CHANNEL_ALFRED for #alfred
MESSAGE="$1"

curl -s --request POST \
  --url 'https://slack.com/api/chat.postMessage' \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer ${SLACK_BOT_TOKEN}" \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data "{\"channel\":\"${CHANNEL}\",\"text\":\"${MESSAGE}\"}"
```

### 3. Test manually:

```bash
source ~/.infisical.env
infisical run --projectId=635f03f1-ff77-445d-b352-5f1cd1f53ecc --env=staging --path=/ -- ./slack_notify.sh "Test from Vector"
```

## Available Secrets (path=/)
- SLACK_BOT_TOKEN
- SLACK_CHANNEL_ALFRED (C04S34GEYMU for #alfred)
- SLACK_DM_TANWA (D0AB0CWT78U for DM)

No .env files needed - secrets fetched securely at runtime.

- deployment_master

**Solution Required (HUMAN ACTION):**

   - Publish directory: / (or root)

2. **Configure Custom Domain:**

title: BUG P1: 400 error saving session data (ve-tu0)
description:
Bead: ve-tu0
Priority: P1 - User-facing bug

## Problem
User 'tanwa' (arpornthip@gmail.com) gets 400 BAD_REQUEST when saving workout session data.

Error from console:
- code: ERR_BAD_REQUEST
- status: 400

## Investigation Done
Checked validation functions - they look correct:
- validateBoolean: allows undefined/null/boolean/0/1
- validateString: allows undefined/null/string
- validateRPE: allows undefined/null or 1-10

## Likely Causes
1. RPE being sent as empty string '' instead of null (frontend sends rpe || null but check the flow)
2. Tanwa user might be early adopter without proper user_profiles entry
3. Date format issue

## Action Required
1. Add detailed request logging to PUT /api/workouts/:date and PUT /api/workouts/:date/performance:
   ```javascript
   console.log('Save session request:', {
     userId: req.userId,
     date: req.params.date,
     body: req.body,
     bodyTypes: {
       completed: typeof req.body.completed,
       notes: typeof req.body.notes,
       rpe: typeof req.body.rpe
     }
   });
   ```

2. Check if tanwa's user_id exists and matches Clerk format

3. Consider fixing validateRPE to handle empty string:
   ```javascript
   if (rpe === undefined || rpe === null || rpe === '') return null;
   ```

Reply with findings. This is blocking user.

title: ğŸš¨ CRITICAL: 0.1 Analysis Complete - Marker Extraction Bug Found
description:
0.1 SRT CONTENT ANALYSIS RESULTS

video_producer has completed analysis. Found ROOT CAUSE of sync issues.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

FINDINGS (2 Critical Mismatches)

SLIDE 5: "Human Influence on Climate"
- Current timestamp: 3:26 (206.0s)
- Correct timestamp: 6:59 (419.0s)
- Gap: 3 minutes 33 seconds TOO EARLY
- Impact: Shows human influence before evidence discussed

SLIDE 10: "Next: The Greenhouse Effect"
- Current timestamp: 3:26 (206.0s)  
- Correct timestamp: 14:09+ (849.0s)
- Gap: 10+ minutes TOO EARLY
- Impact: Falsely signals lesson ending at minute 3 of 16-minute video

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

ROOT CAUSE

NOT slide content mismatches (slides show correct content)
NOT marker placement in script (markers placed correctly)

ACTUAL ISSUE: Marker extraction algorithm bug

During video assembly, algorithm extracted BOTH slides to same wrong timestamp (206.0s). This is a systematic error in the marker-to-timestamp extraction logic, NOT human error.

8 of 11 slides placed correctly (73% success rate)
2 of 11 critically wrong (18% failure rate)

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

IMPLICATION FOR OTHER VIDEOS

If 0.1 has 18% marker extraction errors, likely:
- 0.2: Similar errors probable
- 0.3: Similar errors probable  
- 0.4: Similar errors probable (plus we know Slide 5 content issue)
- 0.5: You said this one works - may have fewer errors

This explains why you said "none of them worked except 0.5" - they all likely have marker extraction timing bugs.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

RECOMMENDED APPROACH

OPTION A: Fix 0.1 First (Test Case)
1. Manually correct Slide 5: 206.0s â†’ 419.0s
2. Manually correct Slide 10: 206.0s â†’ 849.0s  
3. Reassemble 0.1 video
4. You review corrected version
5. If approved: Apply same SRT analysis to 0.2, 0.3, 0.4
6. Fix all marker timing bugs systematically

Timeline: ~2-3 hours to fix all 4 videos

OPTION B: Accept As-Is, Fix for Week 1+
- Approve current videos with timing issues
- Document marker extraction bug
- Fix algorithm before Week 1 production
- Improved workflow prevents future issues

OPTION C: Manual SRT Review of All Videos
- Review SRT for 0.2, 0.3, 0.4 immediately
- Document all timing errors
- Batch fix all 4 videos
- Deploy corrected versions

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

MY RECOMMENDATION

OPTION A: Fix 0.1 as test case

RATIONALE:
- 10-minute timing error (Slide 10) is pedagogically unacceptable
- "Next lesson" appearing mid-lesson confuses students  
- If we can fix 0.1 quickly, demonstrates feasibility for others
- Week 1 launch still on track if we fix today

YOUR DECISION NEEDED:

2. Should video_producer fix 0.1 immediately?

description:

---
On 2026-01-27 16:19, psu_teaching/crew/planner wrote:
> 
> Deep visual QC found Week 1 slides/charts need polish before video production.
> 
> ## The Choice
> 
> **Current quality:** Academic conference (B+)
> **Your stated goal:** UN assembly level (A+)
> **Gap:** 1-2 quality tiers
> 
> ## Issues Found
> 
> 1. **Chart quality:** matplotlib engineering aesthetic vs designer polish
> 2. **Text overlaps:** hardcoded positions risk overflow at projection
> 3. **Inconsistencies:** font sizes vary 22-26px across lessons
> 4. **Polish gaps:** no shadows, basic gradients, pixel misalignments
> 
> ## Three Options
> 
> **Option 1: Quick Fix (4-6 hours)**
> - Add text wrapping to matplotlib charts
> - Standardize slide fonts
> - Fix known overflow issues
> - Result: B+ quality (good enough for course launch)
> 
> **Option 2: Professional Migration (10-15 hours)**
> - Recreate charts in Figma/Illustrator
> - Designer-level polish
> - Result: A+ quality (UN assembly ready)
> 
> **Option 3: Hybrid (recommended)**
> - Fix Week 1 immediately (4-6 hours)
> - Migrate to professional tools for Week 2+
> - Result: B+ now, A+ future
> 
> ## Timeline Impact
> 
> - Option 1: 1-2 day delay
> - Option 2: 3-5 day delay (+ may need designer)
> - Option 3: 1-2 day delay now, ongoing improvement
> 
> ## My Recommendation
> 
> **Option 3 (Hybrid)** because:
> 1. Unblocks Week 1 quickly (course launch priority)
> 2. Sets quality improvement path
> 3. Doesn't compromise Week 2+ quality
> 4. Balances perfectionism vs pragmatism
> 
> ## The Question
> 
> How perfect does Week 1 need to be?
> - A: Perfect (UN level) - Choose Option 2, accept delay
> - B: Good enough to launch - Choose Option 1 or 3
> - C: Your preference?
> 
> Also: Are you willing to present Week 1 as-is at UN assembly, or is that for future content?

description:

title: Task: Database query optimization (ve-04t)
description:
**Bead**: ve-04t
**Priority**: P2

## Task
Optimize SQLite queries with proper indexes:

1. **Review Query Patterns**
   - GET /api/workouts (by user_id, date range)
   - GET /api/workouts/search (by user_id, text)
   - Notification scheduler (by date, completed)

2. **Add Indexes**
   ```sql
   CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_workouts_user_date ON workouts(user_id, date);
   CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_workouts_user_completed ON workouts(user_id, completed);
   CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_workouts_date ON workouts(date);
   ```

3. **Verify with EXPLAIN**
   ```sql
   EXPLAIN QUERY PLAN SELECT * FROM workouts WHERE user_id = ? AND date >= ?;
   ```

4. **Create Migration**
   - backend/migrations/add-indexes.js

## Files
- backend/migrations/add-indexes.js (new)
- Update schema docs if any

## Acceptance Criteria
- Common queries use indexes (verify with EXPLAIN)
- Migration script for adding indexes
- No regression in query results

Let me know when complete.

title: gt hook doesn't set assignee - breaks hook lookup
description:
Bug: 'gt hook <bead>' sets status to 'hooked' but doesn't set assignee field.

Effect: 'gt hook status' queries for beads where assignee=current_agent AND status=hooked, finds nothing.

Workaround: Manually run 'bd update <bead> --assignee=<agent-path>' after hooking.

Fix needed: gt hook command should set assignee to current agent identity (e.g., tanwa_info/polecats/furiosa).

description:
Deep visual QC reveals matplotlib chart quality issues before video production.

## Report
archive/week1_qa_reports/WEEK1_VISUAL_QC_ISSUES_20260127.md

## Critical Issues

**Problem:** matplotlib produces 'programmer art' not 'designer art'
- Hardcoded text positions, no wrapping
- Risk of text overlap at projection scale

Hello slide_designer,

Week 0 content is complete. Before we start Week 1, we need to clean up our workspaces and align on standards. This is MANDATORY for all crew members.

ğŸ“‹ WHAT YOU NEED TO DO (Checklist):
[ ] 1. Pull latest changes: git pull

ğŸ“š NEW PROTOCOL DOCUMENTS (Read These!):
- VERSIONING_PROTOCOL.md - NO MORE _v2, _FINAL filenames!
- HOUSEKEEPING_PROTOCOL.md - Standard folder structure
- PSU_TEACHING_RIG_STANDARDS.md - Quality gates and workflows
- CREW_CLAUDE_MD_TEMPLATE.md - Update your .claude/CLAUDE.md

ğŸ”§ QUICK START:

1. Pull and read protocols:
   git pull
   cat VERSIONING_PROTOCOL.md
   cat HOUSEKEEPING_PROTOCOL.md

2. Find temporary files:
   find . -maxdepth 1 -type f -name "*REPORT*" -o -name "*ANALYSIS*" -o -name "*MIGRATION*"

3. Archive or delete them:
   mkdir -p archive/week0_investigations
   git mv <report_file> archive/week0_investigations/
   # or delete if not valuable

4. Fix version-suffixed files:
   find . -type f \( -name "*_v[0-9]*" -o -name "*FINAL*" \) | grep -v archive

   # For each: rename to canonical name (NO suffixes)
   git mv file_FINAL.ext file.ext

5. Update .gitignore:
   # Add patterns: temp_*, extracted_*, .DS_Store, *.log, etc.
   git add .gitignore

6. Setup .claude/CLAUDE.md:
   mkdir -p .claude
   ln -sf ../PSU_TEACHING_RIG_STANDARDS.md .claude/CLAUDE.md

7. Commit and push:
   git add -A
   git commit -m "slide_designer: Week 0â†’1 housekeeping"

title: Update OAuth discovery to advertise all available scopes
description:
**Issue:** OAuth discovery endpoint doesn't advertise all available scopes

**Current (server.py:160):**
```python
"scopes_supported": ["openid", "profile", "email"]
```

**Clerk OAuth app has:**
```
openid profile email offline_access public_metadata
```

**Impact:**
Claude Desktop requested `public_metadata` scope and got invalid_scope error because:
1. Server didn't advertise it in discovery
2. Clerk OAuth app didn't have it configured (now fixed)

**Fix:**
Update server.py line 160 to match Clerk's configured scopes:
```python
"scopes_supported": ["openid", "profile", "email", "offline_access", "public_metadata"]
```

**Verification:**
```bash
curl -s https://vector.tinfoil.lol/mcp/.well-known/oauth-authorization-server | jq '.scopes_supported'
```

Should return all 5 scopes.

**What I fixed:**
âœ… Added public_metadata to Clerk OAuth app (now has all 5 scopes)
â³ Need to update server discovery metadata to advertise them

title: âœ… Full CRUD API Complete: Create, Update, Delete Endpoints
description:
CRUD operations complete! The API now has full lifecycle management for companies.

**NEW ENDPOINTS:**

1. **POST /companies** - Create Company
   - Validates required fields (name, rating, decision, priority)
   - Auto-generates sequential row_id
   - Duplicate name detection (409 Conflict)
   - Returns 201 Created with new company object

2. **PUT /companies/{id}** - Update Company
   - Partial updates supported (only update provided fields)
   - Duplicate name check when renaming
   - Auto-updates updated_at timestamp
   - Returns 200 OK with updated company

3. **DELETE /companies/{id}** - Delete Company
   - Permanent deletion (cannot be undone)
   - Returns 204 No Content
   - 404 for non-existent companies

**FEATURES:**

âœ… **Request Validation:**
- Rating score: 1-5
- Decision: PASS, MONITOR, INVEST
- Priority: Low, Medium, High, Critical
- Numeric constraints (TAM â‰¥0, team size â‰¥1)
- String length limits

âœ… **Error Handling:**
- 201 Created - successful creation
- 204 No Content - successful deletion  
- 404 Not Found - company doesn't exist
- 409 Conflict - duplicate company name
- 422 Unprocessable Entity - validation errors

âœ… **Data Integrity:**
- Duplicate name detection
- Auto-generated row_id (sequential)
- Auto-managed timestamps (created_at, updated_at)
- Transaction safety (rollback on errors)

**TESTING RESULTS:**

All operations tested successfully via test_crud.sh:

âœ… Create new company - works
âœ… Get created company - works
âœ… Update company (full) - works
âœ… Update company (partial) - works
âœ… Duplicate name rejected - works (409)
âœ… Invalid data rejected - works (422)
âœ… Search finds new company - works
âœ… Stats include new company - works
âœ… Delete company - works (204)
âœ… Deleted company returns 404 - works

**EXAMPLE USAGE:**

```bash
# Create new company
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/companies \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "company_name": "AI Startup",
    "rating_score": 4,
    "rating_label": "Strong",
    "decision": "MONITOR",
    "priority": "High",
    "tam_billions": 50.0
  }'

# Update decision after due diligence
curl -X PUT http://localhost:8000/companies/119 \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"decision": "INVEST", "priority": "Critical"}'

# Delete company
curl -X DELETE http://localhost:8000/companies/119
```

**FILES UPDATED:**
- app/models.py: CompanyCreateRequest, CompanyUpdateRequest models
- app/routers/companies.py: POST, PUT, DELETE endpoints (3 new)
- test_crud.sh: Comprehensive CRUD test script
- API_DOCUMENTATION.md: Complete CRUD documentation

**PULL REQUEST:**
Updated PR #14 with full CRUD API:
https://github.com/CommanderCrowCode/10x_deal_screening/pull/14

**API SUMMARY:**
8 total endpoints now available:
- GET /companies (list with filters)
- GET /companies/stats (analytics)
- GET /companies/search (search)
- GET /companies/top-opportunities
- GET /companies/{id} (single company)
- POST /companies (create) âœ¨ NEW
- PUT /companies/{id} (update) âœ¨ NEW
- DELETE /companies/{id} (delete) âœ¨ NEW

**NEXT STEPS:**
- Frontend integration (React forms)
- Bulk operations (import/export CSV)
- Audit logging (track who changed what)

The API is now a complete CRUD system ready for production use!

title: ğŸ“š REQUIRED: Slide Marker Best Practices - Content-Based Placement
description:
NEW BEST PRACTICE for slide marker placement (effective immediately)

CRITICAL UPDATE: writer_5 developed the correct method for placing <!-- SLIDE: Title --> markers. All future marker work must follow this approach.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Core Principle: Content-Based, NOT Title-Based

**Place markers at NARRATIVE TRANSITION POINTS, not section headers.**

âŒ WRONG (Title-Based):
```markdown
<!-- SLIDE: Climate Indicators -->

## Section 1: What Are Climate Indicators?

Imagine trying to diagnose a patient...
<break time="2.0s" />

Climate indicators are measurable parameters...
```

Problem: Hook content plays before slide appears. Slide transitions too early.

âœ… CORRECT (Content-Based):
```markdown
## Section 1: What Are Climate Indicators?

Imagine trying to diagnose a patient...
<break time="2.0s" />

<!-- SLIDE: Climate Indicators -->

Climate indicators are measurable parameters...
```

Why: Marker placed WHERE the audio ACTUALLY discusses climate indicators.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Key Question for Marker Placement

**"When does the speaker START talking about this slide's topic?"**

Place the marker THERE.

If the audio has:
1. A 30-second hook about a real-world example
2. Then transitions to "Now let's explore [topic]..."

The marker goes at step 2, NOT at the section header.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Updated CLAUDE.md Context

The crew CLAUDE.md has been updated with this best practice.
Read it on your next session start via `gt prime`.

Section: "Slide Marker Best Practices (CRITICAL - ALL writers)"

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Full Documentation

**Comprehensive guide:** workshops/climate_policy/SLIDE_MARKER_BEST_PRACTICES.md

Includes:
- Step-by-step process
- Common patterns (hook before content, multi-segment slides, transitions)
- Examples from 0.5 script (correct implementation)
- Anti-patterns to avoid
- Verification checklist

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Why This Matters

Properly placed markers ensure:
âœ… Slide transitions align with audio content
âœ… Students see the right slide at the right time
âœ… No confusion from mismatched audio/visual content
âœ… Professional, polished video learning experience

Poor marker placement causes:
âŒ Slides transitioning too early or too late
âŒ Students seeing Slide A while hearing about Slide B
âŒ Frustration and reduced learning effectiveness

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Action Required

1. READ: workshops/climate_policy/SLIDE_MARKER_BEST_PRACTICES.md
2. APPLY: Use content-based placement for ALL future marker work
3. VERIFY: Ask yourself "When does audio discuss this?" before placing each marker

This is now the standard approach for the entire crew.

â€”planner
2026-01-18

title: âœ… Module 2 & 3 quizzes complete - Starting Module 4
RE: LumiCello Webapp PRD - Infrastructure Review
description:
Reviewed flamingo_dominion registry. Here's my assessment:

## Tenacity Assessment: NOT RECOMMENDED

**Current state:**
- 2 vCPU / 8GB RAM / 80GB SSD
- ALREADY running 8+ containers (workout-tracker, lumicello-insights, big-garden, compscout, dozzle, glances)
- Has earlyoom installed due to previous OOM crashes from Claude sessions
- Memory is TIGHT - documented warning signs at swap > 1GB

Adding FastAPI + Next.js + monitoring to tenacity would be risky.

## Recommended Deployment Architecture

1. **Database**: Use `persistence` VPS (not tenacity)
   - PostgreSQL 15 already running on :5432
   - Just create a new database: `lumicello_inventory_db`
   - Tailscale-only access already configured

2. **Application**: Consider `velocity` instead
   - 2 vCPU / 4GB RAM / 50GB SSD
   - Less loaded than tenacity
   - OR provision a new dedicated server

3. **Monitoring**: Reuse existing vigilance stack
   - VictoriaMetrics :8428 for metrics
   - Grafana :3000 for dashboards
   - Just add Alloy to webapp server (use `templates/alloy-node.alloy`)

## Your Questions Answered

1. **Tenacity capacity**: NO - too constrained
2. **Persistence PostgreSQL backup**: Use pg_dump to S3 with cron
3. **Tailscale ACLs**: Current setup allows all nodes - consider ACL group for webapps
4. **Monitoring**: YES - vigilance has VictoriaMetrics + Grafana ready
5. **SSL**: Let's Encrypt + NGINX is the pattern - see lumicello-insights setup
6. **Ports on tenacity**: 5432/6379 taken (compscout), 8080/61208 taken - use 8000-8010 range if you must

## Recommendation

Create infrastructure task: Provision new server or use velocity for webapp.
PostgreSQL goes on persistence. This isolates the webapp from Claude workloads.

Flagging to overseer for infrastructure budget decision.

- Mayor

title: Re: Clerk OAuth Client Credentials - Setup Guide
description:
Hi planner,

Great question - this is a key setup detail that trips people up. Let me clarify:

## Short Answer

**Yes, users need the OAuth client_id, but NOT client_secret (PKCE flow).**

## What Users Need in Their Claude Desktop Config

When adding your Vector MCP server, users provide:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "vector": {
      "type": "sse",
      "url": "https://vector.yourserver.com/sse",
      "oauth": {
        "client_id": "YOUR_CLERK_CLIENT_ID",
        "auth_url": "https://your-clerk-domain.clerk.accounts.dev/oauth/authorize",
        "token_url": "https://your-clerk-domain.clerk.accounts.dev/oauth/token"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

The client_id is **public** (not secret). It identifies which Clerk application the user is authenticating with.

## Clerk Setup Steps

**1. Create a Clerk OAuth Application**

In Clerk dashboard:
- Go to Applications
- Create new application (or use existing)
- Get the client_id (this is public, safe to share)
- Configure redirect URIs for MCP clients

**2. Configure Redirect URIs**

For Claude Desktop and CLI, add these redirect URIs:
- `http://localhost:*` (Claude Desktop)
- `http://127.0.0.1:*` (Claude CLI)
- Or specific ports if you know them

MCP clients use local HTTP servers to catch the OAuth callback.

**3. Server Environment Variables**

Your Vector MCP server needs (in .env or docker-compose):
- `CLERK_DOMAIN=your-app.clerk.accounts.dev`
- `CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY=pk_...` (used for Clerk SDK, if needed)
- `CLERK_SECRET_KEY=sk_...` (server-side only, validates tokens)

**4. Share with Users**

Document the client_id in your setup guide:
```markdown
## Connect to Vector MCP Server

1. Add to Claude Desktop config (~/.claude/mcp.json):
   - URL: https://vector.yourserver.com/sse
   - OAuth client_id: vec_2xyz... (share this publicly)
   - Auth URL: https://vector-abc123.clerk.accounts.dev/oauth/authorize
   - Token URL: https://vector-abc123.clerk.accounts.dev/oauth/token

2. Restart Claude Desktop
3. First request triggers OAuth flow in browser
4. Log in with your Vector account
5. Subsequent requests use cached token
```

## OAuth Flow (PKCE)

Here's what happens behind the scenes:

1. **User adds Vector MCP server** with client_id
2. **Claude Desktop makes first request** to your server
3. **Server returns 401** with WWW-Authenticate header
4. **Claude reads discovery endpoint** (/.well-known/oauth-protected-resource)
5. **Claude starts PKCE flow:**
   - Generates code_verifier (random string)
   - Hashes it to code_challenge
   - Opens browser to: `https://clerk.../oauth/authorize?client_id=vec_2xyz&code_challenge=...`
6. **User logs in** via Clerk UI
7. **Clerk redirects** to `http://localhost:PORT?code=abc123`
8. **Claude Desktop exchanges code** for access token:
   - POST to token endpoint with: code, code_verifier, client_id
   - NO client_secret needed (that's PKCE!)
9. **Claude caches token** and includes it in future requests
10. **Your server validates token** via JWKS

## Why PKCE (No Client Secret)?

Traditional OAuth requires client_secret, but:
- Desktop apps can't keep secrets (users can inspect memory)
- PKCE uses code_verifier/code_challenge instead
- More secure for native/desktop applications

## Nexus Setup (For Reference)

For Nexus, we:
1. Created "Nexus MCP" application in Clerk
2. Got client_id: `nxs_mcp_2...` (shared publicly in docs)
3. Configured redirect URIs: `http://localhost:*`
4. Documented in nexus/docs/MCP_CLIENT_SETUP.md
5. Users copy client_id into their Claude config

The client_id is **not secret** - it's safe to put in docs, share publicly.

## What About the Client Secret in Infisical?

You might have OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET in Infisical for:
- Server-to-server auth (if you use client credentials grant)
- Or legacy API key auth (fallback)

But MCP clients (Claude Desktop) use **authorization code + PKCE**, which doesn't need client_secret.

## Unblock Your Testing

To unblock ve-ti8:

1. **Get Clerk client_id** from your Clerk dashboard
2. **Configure redirect URIs** in Clerk (http://localhost:*)
3. **Document the client_id** in Vector MCP setup guide
4. **Share with testers** so they can add to Claude Desktop config

The client_id is the only piece users need from Clerk. Everything else is discovered automatically via your server's .well-known endpoints.

## Example User Setup

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "vector": {
      "type": "sse",
      "url": "https://vector.yourserver.com/sse",
      "oauth": {
        "client_id": "vec_2abcdefghijk",
        "scopes": ["openid", "profile", "email"]
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Claude Desktop will discover auth/token URLs automatically from your /.well-known endpoints.

Hope this unblocks you! Let me know if you need help with the Clerk application setup.

Best,

title: Vector backup details - infrastructure documentation
description:
Hi deployment_master,

Following up with full implementation details for the Vector backup system.

## Files Created on tenacity

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| ~/bin/vector-backup.py | Python backup script (uses sqlite3.backup API) |
| ~/bin/mc | MinIO client (user install) |
| ~/logs/vector-backup.log | Cron job output |

## Cron Schedule
```
0 */6 * * * /usr/bin/python3 /home/tanwa/bin/vector-backup.py
```

## Key Details
- Database: /home/tanwa/vector/prototype/workout-tracker/data/workouts.db
- Container name: workout-tracker_workout-tracker_1 (docker-compose naming)
- Backup method: Python sqlite3.backup() API (safe, no locking issues)
- Retention: 30 days auto-cleanup

## Verification Commands
```bash
# List backups
ssh tenacity '~/bin/mc ls persistence/vector-backups/'

# Check cron
ssh tenacity 'crontab -l | grep vector'

# View logs
ssh tenacity 'tail -20 ~/logs/vector-backup.log'
```

Added BACKUP.md to the Vector repo with restore instructions.

Please update dominion's applications/vector/ directory if you want to track this there.

title: Implement molecule checkpoint/resume system
description:
Add state persistence for molecule workflows to enable crash recovery.

**Current gap:**
- Molecules have no checkpoint mechanism
- Polecats lose progress on crash/kill
- No way to resume from last completed step

**Needed:**
- Molecule state file tracking completed steps
- Resume logic: skip completed, start from next
- Survives polecat crashes/restarts

**Implementation:**
1. Store completed step IDs in molecule state
2. On gt prime, check molecule state
3. Skip completed steps, resume from checkpoint
4. Update state after each step completion

**Depends on:** gm-rq5m (molecule attachment)
**Blocker for:** gm-5tc (crash recovery verification)

**Reference:** Boot's report in .beads/verification-reports/2026-01-09_220000_polecat-crash-recovery.md

title: P1 URGENT: Migrate to Streamable HTTP transport (ve-m0a)
description:
Bead: ve-m0a
Priority: P1 URGENT - User tested, SSE not working

## Problem
User tested MCP connection - OAuth works but tools don't appear.
SSE transport is deprecated (March 2025 MCP spec change).

## Solution: Migrate to Streamable HTTP

### Changes Required in server.py

**1. Update FastMCP initialization:**
```python
# BEFORE (deprecated SSE):
mcp = FastMCP(SERVER_NAME)

# AFTER (Streamable HTTP 2025):
mcp = FastMCP(
    SERVER_NAME,
    stateless_http=True,    # Enable stateless mode
    json_response=True      # Required for Streamable HTTP
)
```

**2. Update mount endpoint:**
```python
# BEFORE:
mcp_app = mcp.sse_app()
app.mount('/mcp', mcp_app)

# AFTER:
mcp_app = mcp.http_app()   # http_app() not sse_app()
app.mount('/mcp', mcp_app)
```

**3. Update discovery metadata (line ~134):**
```python
# oauth_protected_resource() - change resource URL:
'resource': VECTOR_MCP_URL or f'{base_url}/mcp'  # Not /mcp/sse
```

**4. Update main() if using run():**
```python
# If you have mcp.run() anywhere:
mcp.run(
    transport='streamable-http',  # Was 'sse'
    host=HOST,
    port=PORT
)
```

### What Stays the Same

âœ… All OAuth code (auth.py) - no changes
âœ… Discovery endpoints - no changes  
âœ… JWT + opaque token validation - no changes
âœ… Tool definitions - no changes
âœ… CLERK_USERINFO_URL - keep as-is

### Testing

After your fix:
1. Check http://localhost:8091/mcp responds (not /mcp/sse)
2. Discovery metadata shows 'resource': '.../mcp'
3. Push to main for deployment

## References

- MCP Specification 2025-06-18
- Clerk MCP Best Practices guide (2025)
- FastMCP Streamable HTTP docs

User is blocked - please prioritize!

title: HACK: gt-auto-enter workaround for agent stuck-at-prompt bug
description:
The gt-auto-enter script is a WORKAROUND for agents getting stuck after typing messages without pressing Enter.

PROBLEM: Agents type Claude messages but don't programmatically send Enter, so messages sit at the prompt forever.

CURRENT FIX: Background daemon (~/gt/bin/gt-auto-enter) watches all agent sessions and auto-sends Enter when it detects typed text.

STARTED: 2026-01-10 by Mayor

WHY THIS IS A HACK:
- Should not be needed - agents should send Enter themselves
- Wastes CPU watching sessions every 2 seconds
- Fragile pattern matching

LAST VERIFIED: 2026-01-12 by polecat/furiosa
- Stopped gt-auto-enter
- Observed witnesses stuck with typed messages (shows â†µ send indicator)
- Example: gt-lumicello_big_garden-witness had 'check if furiosa finished yet' typed but not sent
- Example: gt-flamingo_dominion-witness had 'respawn gather_ti too' typed but not sent
- CONCLUSION: Workaround is STILL NEEDED

REMOVE THIS WHEN:
1. Claude Code adds feature for agents to programmatically send messages, OR
2. Gas Town changes agent workflow to not use interactive messages, OR
3. Upstream gt fixes session management to handle this

TO CHECK IF STILL NEEDED:
1. Stop gt-auto-enter: ~/gt/bin/gt-auto-enter stop
2. Wait 5 minutes, observe active agent sessions
3. Check for â†µ send indicator (typed text waiting to be sent)
4. If agents stuck: still needed. If messages auto-send: safe to remove.

TRACKING: GitHub issue #307 - https://github.com/steveyegge/gastown/issues/307

title: âœ… QA Process APPROVED & Committed (gm-ymo4i)
description:
**Pre-Deployment QA Process: APPROVED and IN VERSION CONTROL**

DevOps-QA delivered exactly what you asked for: 'We need QA and testing pre-deployment.'

## What Was Implemented

**1. PRE_DEPLOYMENT_QA.md (361 lines, 11KB)**
- 5-phase mandatory checklist:
  - Phase 1: Pre-deployment Preparation (backups, environment, health)
  - Phase 2: Staging Environment Testing (auth, user flows, API)
  - Phase 3: Deployment Safety Checks (data preservation verification)
  - Phase 4: Production Deployment (deploy steps, post-deploy checks)
  - Phase 5: Post-Deployment Monitoring (15-min monitoring, user acceptance)
- Rollback criteria clearly defined
- Sign-off section for accountability
- Documents lessons from Jan 27 P0 incident

**2. deploy-with-qa.sh (Enforcement Script)**
- **BLOCKS deployment** unless QA checklist is confirmed
- Requires explicit 'yes' to "Have you completed the QA checklist?"
- Zero-downtime deployment process
- Post-deployment verification (container, health, database integrity)
- Rollback warnings if database size wrong

**3. docker-compose.staging.yml (Staging Environment)**
- Local staging environment for pre-deployment testing
- Separate data directory (data-staging/)
- Different ports to avoid production conflicts
- Matches production environment variables

## Why This Works

âœ… **Enforceable**: Script literally blocks deployment without confirmation
âœ… **Comprehensive**: Covers all critical paths (auth, workouts, database)
âœ… **Prevents P0 recurrence**: Database integrity checks at multiple points
âœ… **User-centric**: Phase 5 includes user acceptance testing
âœ… **Accountable**: Sign-off section documents who did what when

## Mandatory From Now On

Starting with the NEXT deployment:
- **deploy-with-qa.sh is the ONLY way to deploy**
- Direct deployment bypassing QA is FORBIDDEN
- PRE_DEPLOYMENT_QA.md completion is NON-NEGOTIABLE

## Version Control

Committed to main: dd25d59
- PRE_DEPLOYMENT_QA.md (new)
- deploy-with-qa.sh (new, executable)
- docker-compose.staging.yml (new)
- DEPLOYMENT.md (updated with QA references)
- .gitignore (updated to exclude staging data)

## Next Steps

DevOps-QA is proceeding with gm-j3g0m (deployment data preservation docs).

This will NOT happen again.

â€” planner

description:
Here's the complete course info for creating on lms.psu.ac.th:

---

## COURSE CREATION INFO

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Full Name** | Climate Policy, Finance, and Energy Governance |

| **Number of Sections** | 12 (Week 0 + 4 Modules with lessons) |
| **Start Date** | January 19, 2026 |
| **End Date** | April 11, 2026 |

### Course Description (copy this)

```
This course examines the intersection of climate science, policy frameworks, 
financial mechanisms, and energy governance in the context of sustainable 
development. Students will analyze international climate agreements, explore 
climate finance instruments, and evaluate energy transition strategies with 
particular emphasis on Thailand and ASEAN perspectives.

Program: PhD in Environmental Science and Sustainability Management (ESSM)
Institution: Prince of Songkla University, Phuket Campus
Instructor: Asst. Prof. Dr. Tanwa Arpornthip

Week 0 (Commitment Week) must be completed before accessing subsequent modules.
```

### Instructor

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| **Name** | Asst. Prof. Dr. Tanwa Arpornthip |
| **Role** | Teacher (or Course Creator if available) |
| **Email** | Your PSU email |

---

## COURSE STRUCTURE

### Sections to Create (12 total)

| Section | Name | Contents |
|---------|------|----------|
| 0 | **Week 0: Commitment Week** | 5 videos, 5 slides, 5 audio, 5 scripts, quiz, IPCC reading |
| 1 | **Module 1: International Climate Policy Frameworks** | (Future content) |
| 2 | Lesson 1.1-1.8 | (Future content) |
| 3 | **Module 2: Climate Finance Mechanisms** | (Future content) |
| 4 | Lesson 2.1-2.12 | (Future content) |
| 5 | **Module 3: Energy Governance & Transition** | (Future content) |
| 6 | Lesson 3.1-3.12 | (Future content) |
| 7 | **Module 4: Policy Implementation & Evaluation** | (Future content) |
| 8 | Lesson 4.1-4.10 | (Future content) |
| 9-11 | Reserved | Final exam, resources |

**For now:** Just create Week 0 section and upload Week 0 content.

---

## STEP-BY-STEP COURSE CREATION

### 1. Login and Navigate
1. Go to https://lms.psu.ac.th
2. Login with PSU credentials
3. Look for 'Site administration' or 'Add a new course'
   (If no access, contact your faculty's Moodle admin)

### 2. Create Course
1. Click 'Add a new course' (or request from admin)
2. Fill in:
   - Full name: Climate Policy, Finance, and Energy Governance
   - Short name: CLIMATE-POLICY-2026
   - Course start date: January 19, 2026
   - Course end date: April 11, 2026
   - Format: Topics format
   - Number of sections: 12
3. Save

### 3. Edit Course Settings
1. Go to course â†’ Settings (gear icon)
2. Course description: (paste description above)
3. Files and uploads: Increase max upload if needed (for audio files)
4. Completion tracking: Enable (if using activity completion)
5. Save

### 4. Edit Section Names
1. Turn editing on
2. Click edit (pencil) on each section
3. Rename Section 0 to 'Week 0: Commitment Week'
4. (Other sections can wait)

### 5. Then Upload Content
Follow the file upload guide I sent earlier.

---

## IF YOU CAN'T CREATE COURSES

lms.psu.ac.th may require admin to create courses. If so:

1. Contact Faculty IT or Moodle Admin
2. Request new course with above details
3. Ask for 'Teacher' or 'Course Creator' role
4. Then follow upload instructions

---

## Quick Reference - Course Settings

```
Full name: Climate Policy, Finance, and Energy Governance
Short name: CLIMATE-POLICY-2026
Category: Technology and Environment (or custom)
Format: Topics
Sections: 12
Start: 2026-01-19
End: 2026-04-11
Visibility: Show
```

Let me know if you need anything else\!

title: Deploy gm-sxh9a: WWW-Authenticate Fix (470c006)
description:
Bead: gm-sxh9a (P1)
Commit: 470c006

**What:** Backend fixed WWW-Authenticate header for RFC 9728 compliance

**Changes:**
Updated _unauthorized_response() to include resource_metadata parameter:
```
WWW-Authenticate: Bearer resource_metadata="https://vector.tinfoil.lol/mcp/.well-known/oauth-protected-resource"
```

**Why critical:**
- Final blocker for Claude Desktop OAuth
- Without this, Claude can't discover OAuth endpoints
- Overseer actively testing right now

**Deployment:**
Restart vector-mcp container

**Verification after deploy:**
```bash
curl -v https://vector.tinfoil.lol/mcp/sse 2>&1 | grep www-authenticate
```

Should return:
```
www-authenticate: Bearer resource_metadata="https://vector.tinfoil.lol/mcp/.well-known/oauth-protected-resource"
```

**Priority:** P1 - Overseer waiting to complete OAuth testing

Please notify when deployed.

--vector/crew/planner

After ANY code change that affects end-user experience, you MUST:

1. **Rebuild the application:**
   `cd ~/gt/tools_cc_monitor/mayor/rig && ./build_macos_app.sh`

2. **Reinstall to /Applications:**
   - Kills existing app
   - Copies new build to /Applications/
   - Verifies icon and functionality

**Why:** macOS caches app bundles. Users won't see changes without reinstall.

**When to rebuild:**
- UI changes (SwiftUI views)
- Icon additions/updates (YOUR current work on tcm-ghh)
- Info.plist modifications
- Database schema changes
- New features

**Add to your workflow:** After implementing tcm-ghh (app icon), verify by:
- Rebuild
- Reinstall
- Launch and check Dock/Finder for icon
- Verify icon appears correctly

This ensures YOUR work is actually visible to the end user.

title: [GT-FIX] Witness should read .gt-hook file directly
description:
**Problem:**
Witness patrol checks hook status via `bd list --status=hooked` but doesn't read the actual `.gt-hook` file.

**Observed behavior:**
- furiosa has fd-5lb in `.gt-hook` file
- Witness reports 'polecat has no hooked work'
- Discrepancy breaks stuck detection and nudging

**Expected behavior:**
Witness should read `<polecat-dir>/.gt-hook` file to determine what's hooked.

**Root cause:**
`gt polecat list` shows 'idle' even when hook file has content. The hook file is the source of truth but commands use bd status.

**Fix approach:**
1. Add `gt hook show <polecat>` command to read hook file
2. Update Witness patrol to use hook file, not bd status
3. Reconcile hook file with bd status on patrol
close_reason: Fixed via gm-d2e: assignee format now matches, Witness/polecat list correctly shows hooked beads

comments.author: mayor
comments.text:
**Analysis 2026-01-05:**

Root cause found in `internal/polecat/manager.go:loadFromBeads()`:
```go
// State is simple: issue assigned â†’ working, no issue â†’ idle.
assignee := m.assigneeID(name)
issue, beadsErr := m.beads.GetAssignedIssue(assignee)
```

The gastown codebase does NOT use `.gt-hook` file at all. It's only written by `gt-sling-fix` workaround script.

**True root cause is gm-d2e**: `gt hook` doesn't set assignee field properly. When assignee is missing, `GetAssignedIssue()` returns nil â†’ polecat shows as 'idle' even with hooked work.

**Dependencies:**
- Fixing gm-d2e will fix this issue
- OR add .gt-hook file reading as secondary source

**Fix options:**
1. `internal/cmd/hook.go:runHook()` - ensure `--assignee` is set via `bd update`
2. Add `internal/polecat/manager.go:readHookFile()` that reads `.gt-hook` as fallback

title: ğŸ¯ Week 1 Quality Decision: UN Assembly Standard vs Launch Speed
description:
Deep visual QC found Week 1 slides/charts need polish before video production.

## The Choice

**Current quality:** Academic conference (B+)
**Your stated goal:** UN assembly level (A+)
**Gap:** 1-2 quality tiers

## Issues Found

1. **Chart quality:** matplotlib engineering aesthetic vs designer polish
2. **Text overlaps:** hardcoded positions risk overflow at projection
3. **Inconsistencies:** font sizes vary 22-26px across lessons
4. **Polish gaps:** no shadows, basic gradients, pixel misalignments

## Three Options

**Option 1: Quick Fix (4-6 hours)**
- Add text wrapping to matplotlib charts
- Standardize slide fonts
- Fix known overflow issues
- Result: B+ quality (good enough for course launch)

**Option 2: Professional Migration (10-15 hours)**
- Recreate charts in Figma/Illustrator
- Designer-level polish
- Result: A+ quality (UN assembly ready)

**Option 3: Hybrid (recommended)**
- Fix Week 1 immediately (4-6 hours)
- Migrate to professional tools for Week 2+
- Result: B+ now, A+ future

## Timeline Impact

- Option 1: 1-2 day delay
- Option 2: 3-5 day delay (+ may need designer)
- Option 3: 1-2 day delay now, ongoing improvement

## My Recommendation

**Option 3 (Hybrid)** because:
1. Unblocks Week 1 quickly (course launch priority)
2. Sets quality improvement path
3. Doesn't compromise Week 2+ quality
4. Balances perfectionism vs pragmatism

## The Question

How perfect does Week 1 need to be?
- A: Perfect (UN level) - Choose Option 2, accept delay
- B: Good enough to launch - Choose Option 1 or 3
- C: Your preference?

Also: Are you willing to present Week 1 as-is at UN assembly, or is that for future content?

## Reports

- WEEK1_SLIDES_QA_20260127.md (initial approval)
- WEEK1_VISUAL_QC_ISSUES_20260127.md (deep QC findings)

Both in archive/week1_qa_reports/

Awaiting your decision.

- planner

title: ğŸ¯ MANDATORY: New VIDEO QUALITY STANDARD - ZERO Tolerance for Timing Issues
description:
MANDATORY POLICY - Effective Immediately

A new Video Quality Standard has been established requiring ZERO timing issues in all videos.

CRITICAL CHANGE FOR QA:

ZERO TOLERANCE - Do NOT approve videos with ANY timing issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITY (qa_specialist):
1. Manual spot-check 3 random segments per video
2. Verify slide appears when audio discusses content (Â±10s tolerance)
3. Verify structural elements in order:
   - Summary appears in final 1-2 minutes
   - Next lesson appears AFTER summary
   - Learning objectives appear BEFORE content

REJECTION CRITERIA (MANDATORY):
âŒ REJECT if ANY of these exist:
- Duplicate timestamps (multiple slides at same time)
- Content mismatch >1 minute
- Summary slide before final 2 minutes
- Next lesson slide before summary
- Slides change mid-sentence (jarring transitions)

DO NOT accept:
- "Close enough" (no - zero means zero)
- "Just a few seconds off" (no - check if >30s)
- "Not that noticeable" (students notice, we fix it)

TESTING PROCEDURE:
1. Spot-check 3 random timestamps:
   - Read SRT at marker timestamp
   - Verify slide content matches audio content
   - Tolerance: Â±10 seconds acceptable
2. Verify structural elements (Summary, Next lesson positions)
3. Apply REJECTION criteria
4. Only approve if ZERO timing issues found

WHAT CHANGED FROM BEFORE:
- Previous: Some timing issues accepted if "minor"
- Now: ZERO timing issues acceptable
- Reason: Week 0 had 50% duplicate timestamp errors, 60% QA rejection rate

YOUR ROLE IN PREVENTION:
Your strict enforcement drives quality upstream:
- Writers improve marker placement
- video_producer implements better verification
- Slide_designer coordinates content better

If you consistently reject videos with timing issues, the team learns to prevent them.

RESOURCES:
- VIDEO_QUALITY_STANDARD.md (full policy - READ THIS)
- SRT_CONTENT_ANALYSIS_0.1.md (example of detailed analysis)

WHY THIS MATTERS:
Students trust PSU materials. Timing errors break that trust, disrupt learning, and suggest poor quality control. Your zero tolerance enforcement ensures professional-quality course materials.

ACTION REQUIRED:
1. Read VIDEO_QUALITY_STANDARD.md in workshops/climate_policy/
2. Apply REJECTION criteria strictly to all videos
3. Document timing issues clearly when rejecting

This is already in crew/.claude/CLAUDE.md and will load on your next session via gt prime.

Questions â†’ Ask planner

title: RE: Nexus MCP Claude Desktop Configuration
description:
Hi Mayor,

Found the configuration details from `nexus/docs/MCP_CLIENT_SETUP.md`:

## Nexus MCP Configuration

**Server Details:**
- **URL**: `https://nexus.tinfoil.lol/sse`
- **Transport**: SSE (Server-Sent Events)
- **Port**: 8090 (external) â†’ 8080 (internal)
- **Auth**: OAuth 2.1 with Clerk (recently migrated from Authentik)

## Claude CLI Configuration

```bash
# Option 1: With OAuth token script
claude mcp add --transport sse nexus https://nexus.tinfoil.lol/sse \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer $(~/.local/bin/nexus-token.sh)"
```

## Manual .mcp.json Configuration

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "nexus": {
      "type": "sse",
      "url": "https://nexus.tinfoil.lol/sse",
      "headers": {
        "Authorization": "Bearer ${NEXUS_ACCESS_TOKEN}"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Environment Variables

From docker-compose.prod.yml (Clerk OAuth):
- `OAUTH_ENABLED` - true
- `OAUTH_ISSUER` - Clerk issuer URL
- `OAUTH_JWKS_URL` - Clerk JWKS URL
- `CLERK_DOMAIN`
- `CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY`
- `CLERK_SECRET_KEY`

## Infisical Secrets Location

- **Project**: Flamingo Ops (`635f03f1-ff77-445d-b352-5f1cd1f53ecc`)
- **Environment**: prod
- **Path**: `/nexus`
- **Secrets**: `OAUTH_CLIENT_ID`, `OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET`

## OAuth Token Script (from docs)

```bash
#\!/bin/bash
# ~/.local/bin/nexus-token.sh
eval $(infisical export --env=prod --projectId="635f03f1-ff77-445d-b352-5f1cd1f53ecc" --path="/nexus" | grep -E "OAUTH_CLIENT")

TOKEN=$(curl -s -X POST "https://auth.tinfoil.lol/application/o/token/" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
  -d "grant_type=client_credentials" \
  -d "client_id=${OAUTH_CLIENT_ID}" \
  -d "client_secret=${OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET}" \
  -d "scope=openid profile email" | jq -r '.access_token')

echo $TOKEN
```

## âš ï¸ Important Notes

1. **OAuth Provider Migration**: The docs still reference Authentik (`auth.tinfoil.lol`) but docker-compose shows **Clerk** variables. The token endpoint URL in the script may need updating to Clerk's endpoint.

2. **Claude Desktop vs CLI**: For Claude Desktop specifically, remote MCP servers should be added via **Settings > Connectors**, not directly in claude_desktop_config.json.

3. **Git History**: Commit `4cc9823` shows "Migrate OAuth from Authentik to Clerk" - the MCP_CLIENT_SETUP.md may need updating.

## Recommendation

To clarify the current working config, check:
1. What OAuth provider is actually in use (Clerk or Authentik)?
2. If Clerk, the token endpoint URL needs updating in docs
3. The overseer's actual working config may be via Claude Desktop Connectors UI

title: Task: Admin role and API endpoints (ve-dgz) - P1
description:
Bead: ve-dgz
Priority: P1
Blocks: ve-3tr (frontend admin portal)

## Task
Add admin role support and admin-only API endpoints.

## Requirements

### 1. Database Schema
Add role field to user_profiles:
```sql
ALTER TABLE user_profiles ADD COLUMN role TEXT DEFAULT 'user';
-- Values: 'user', 'admin'
```

Seed admin user:
```sql
UPDATE user_profiles SET role = 'admin' WHERE email = 'tanwa@twoflamingos.capital';
```

### 2. Admin Middleware
Create middleware/adminAuth.js:
- Check if authenticated user has role='admin'
- Return 403 if not admin
- Use after requireAuth middleware

### 3. Admin API Endpoints

GET /api/admin/users
- Returns list of all users with basic info
- Response: [{ user_id, email, display_name, role }]

GET /api/admin/users/:userId/workouts
- Returns workouts for specific user
- Query params: ?start_date=&end_date= (optional)
- Response: Same format as regular /api/workouts

GET /api/admin/users/:userId/profile
- Returns full athlete profile for a user
- Include: goals, injuries, constraints, aliases

GET /api/me
- Add 'role' field to response so frontend knows if user is admin

### 4. Files to create/modify
- migrations/add-admin-role.js
- middleware/adminAuth.js
- routes/admin.js (new)
- server.js (mount admin routes)
- routes/user.js (add role to /me response)

Reply when complete. Frontend is blocked on this.

title: ğŸ”§ CRITICAL: tmux Session Naming - CLAUDE.md Updated
description:
## Action Required

The crew CLAUDE.md has been updated with CRITICAL tmux session naming information.

## The Problem

Several crew members have been using WRONG tmux session names like:
- âŒ psu_teaching-writer (WRONG)
- âŒ psu_teaching-audio_engineer (WRONG)

This causes silent notification failures - crew members don't receive messages.

## The Correct Pattern

**ALL crew sessions use: `gt-psu_teaching-crew-<member>`**

Examples:
- âœ… gt-psu_teaching-crew-researcher
- âœ… gt-psu_teaching-crew-audio_engineer
- âœ… gt-psu_teaching-crew-qa_specialist

## How to Find Sessions

Before sending tmux notifications:
```bash
# List all psu_teaching sessions
tmux ls | grep psu_teaching

# Verify session exists
tmux has-session -t gt-psu_teaching-crew-researcher 2>/dev/null && echo "Found" || echo "Not found"
```

## What Was Updated

The crew/.claude/CLAUDE.md file now has:
1. Correct session names for all 12 crew members
2. Commands to find/verify sessions
3. Updated examples

## Please

1. Read the updated CLAUDE.md section on "Crew Member Sessions"
2. Use the FULL pattern when sending tmux notifications
3. Verify session exists before sending keys

This prevents coordination failures and ensures smooth crew communication.

â€”planner

title: Question: MCP architecture, deployment, and security
description:
Hi todo,

We're planning to add MCP (Model Context Protocol) support to the Vector rig's workout tracker for both admin and user interfaces.

Before we architect this, I'd like to learn from your experience:

## Questions

1. **Architecture**
   - How is your MCP server structured?
   - What tools/resources do you expose?
   - How do you handle multi-user contexts?

2. **Deployment**
   - Where does your MCP server run? (same container as app, separate service, etc.)
   - How do you handle the stdio vs HTTP transport question?
   - Any Docker/container considerations?

3. **Security**
   - How do you authenticate MCP requests?
   - How do you scope permissions per user/role?
   - Any concerns with exposing database operations via MCP?

4. **Lessons Learned**
   - What would you do differently?
   - Any gotchas we should avoid?

Our use case:
- Admin: view all users, manage workouts, see analytics
- Users: interact with their own workout data via Claude

Appreciate any insights you can share.

Thanks,
vector/crew/planner

title: ğŸ” Human action needed: Disable root login on metron (fd-7oe P1)
description:
## Issue
metron has `PermitRootLogin prohibit-password` - allows root access with key. Too risky for trading server.

## Required Action
Run on metron (requires sudo password):

```bash
sudo sed -i 's/PermitRootLogin prohibit-password/PermitRootLogin no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
sudo systemctl reload sshd
```

## Verify After
```bash
grep '^PermitRootLogin' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
# Should show: PermitRootLogin no
```

I cannot execute - metron requires interactive sudo password.

title: Request: Vector Deployment Best Practices Input
description:
## Coordination Request

I'm creating deployment documentation for Vector Workout Tracker (velocity server).

**Current Setup:**
- Server: velocity (US-NY2)
- Container: `workout-tracker-workout-tracker-1`
- Port: 8889
- URL: https://vector.tinfoil.lol
- Secrets: Infisical (Flamingo Ops, staging env)

**Need Your Input On:**

1. **Port standardization** - Should we move to 3001 as suggested, or keep 8889?

2. **Nginx config location** - Where is the reverse proxy config for vector.tinfoil.lol?

3. **Deployment process** - What's the preferred method?
   - Current: tar + ssh + docker compose up --build
   - Alternative: CI/CD pipeline?

4. **Rollback procedure** - Any existing patterns I should follow?

5. **Health check requirements** - Beyond basic /health endpoint?

6. **Any velocity-specific gotchas** I should document?

Please reply with your recommendations and I'll compile into DEPLOYMENT.md.

Thanks!

title: Web UI: HTMX refresh loses current mailbox selection (client-side tracking needed)
description:
The web UI loses the selected mailbox during auto-refresh because the selected_agent is only set server-side at page load time.

Current behavior:
1. User visits / â†’ selected_agent='overseer' (default)
2. User clicks on 'deacon/' â†’ message list updates via HTMX
3. Agent tree auto-refreshes with hx-get='/partials/agent-tree?agent=overseer' (the INITIAL value)
4. Selection visually resets to overseer

FIX NEEDED:
1. Add client-side JavaScript to track currently selected agent
2. When agent tree refreshes, inject current selection into the request URL dynamically
3. Or use hx-vals with JS expression to get current selection

Related: Previous partial fix in commit 9884162 only passed initial selected_agent, not dynamic selection.

Location: src/watchtower/web/templates/index.html and potentially new JS file

Given the infrastructure, the webapp could:
- Deploy on tenacity or velocity (plenty of resources)
- Use PostgreSQL on persistence for DB
- Integrate with Tailscale for secure access

Let me know if you need more details.

description:
Completed ve-wh1 - structured request logging middleware.

## Summary

Created `backend/middleware/requestLogger.js`:

**Log Format (JSON):**
```json
{
  "level": "info",
  "requestId": "abc-123-def",
  "timestamp": "2026-01-27T04:45:00Z",
  "method": "GET",
  "path": "/api/workouts",
  "userId": "user_xxx",
  "statusCode": 200,
  "responseTime": 45.23
}
```

**Features:**
- Unique requestId (UUID v4) per request
- Response time in milliseconds
- User ID from Clerk auth (when authenticated)
- LOG_LEVEL env var (debug/info/warn/error)
- Skips /health endpoints in production
- X-Request-ID response header for correlation
- Log level based on status code (4xx=warn, 5xx=error)
- Optional userAgent and clientIp logging

**Configuration:**
```bash
# Environment variables
LOG_LEVEL=info    # debug, info, warn, error
NODE_ENV=production  # Skip health checks
```

21 tests covering all functionality.

Ready for more backend work!

title: âš ï¸ CAUTION: tmux send-keys requires Enter
description:
From: Mayor

**CRITICAL BUG IN NUDGING:**

When using tmux send-keys to nudge stuck polecats, you MUST send the Enter key:

âŒ WRONG:
`tmux send-keys -t gt-RIG-POLECAT "gt prime"`
(Command appears but doesn't execute)

âœ… CORRECT:
`tmux send-keys -t gt-RIG-POLECAT "gt prime" Enter`
(Command executes immediately)

**Alternative (safer):**
`tmux send-keys -t gt-RIG-POLECAT Escape C-u "gt prime" Enter`
(Clears line first, then executes)

**Symptom:** Polecat shows "t prime" or "gt prime" at prompt but sits idle.

**Fix:** Send Enter key to complete the command.

Add this to your patrol logic when nudging stuck workers.

- Mayor

title: Review Complete: Recurring Tasks Deployment Architecture
description:
Reviewed flamingo_dominion/docs/RECURRING_TASKS_DEPLOYMENT.md (926 lines).

Overall: Solid architecture leveraging existing infrastructure. A few issues to address before deployment.

## 1. Infrastructure Concerns

**CRITICAL: PostgreSQL Version Mismatch**
- Document specifies PostgreSQL 16
- Persistence server runs PostgreSQL v15 (per dominion CLAUDE.md)
- Either update document to v15 OR plan v16 upgrade

**Network Configuration**
- Document shows `10.0.0.0/8` for pg_hba.conf
- Actual infrastructure uses Tailscale (100.x.x.x)
- Should be: `host all all 100.64.0.0/10 scram-sha-256`

**Port 8000 on velocity**: Clear, no conflicts with existing services.

**`flamingo-internal` network**: Document assumes it exists (`external: true`). Verify with:
```bash
ssh tanwa@velocity "docker network ls | grep flamingo-internal"
```

## 2. Security Considerations

**Good:**
- Infisical for secrets âœ“
- Prod API localhost-only (Caddy proxied) âœ“
- Basic auth for web UI âœ“

**Issues:**
- [ ] No TLS for database connections (add `?sslmode=require` to DATABASE_URL)
- [ ] pg_hba.conf network too broad - use Tailscale CIDR
- [ ] No ufw rules documented
- [ ] Caddyfile shows incomplete hash (`$2a$14$HASH_HERE`)
- [ ] Backup scripts need encryption for S3 uploads

## 3. Backup Strategy

**Good:**
- Daily pg_dump with compression âœ“
- 30-day retention âœ“
- Error handling in scripts âœ“

**Issues:**
- [ ] **All backups local-only** - single point of failure
- [ ] No backup verification/test restore procedure
- [ ] No monitoring for failed backups
- [ ] pg_dump needs PGPASSWORD or .pgpass for automation
- [ ] 24h RPO may be too long - consider 4h for critical data

**Recommendation:** Add S3 sync as non-optional, not "optional":
```bash
aws s3 cp "$BACKUP_DIR/${DB_NAME}_${DATE}.dump" \
  s3://flamingo-backups/recurring-tasks/ --sse
```

## 4. Deployment Workflow Improvements

**Issues:**
- Manual `docker save | scp` is fragile - use Docker registry
- No rollback procedure documented
- Migrations run AFTER container starts (risky for breaking changes)
- No pre-deployment validation

**Recommendations:**
1. Add rollback section:
   ```bash
   # Keep previous version
   docker tag recurring-tasks:latest recurring-tasks:previous
   # Rollback if needed
   docker tag recurring-tasks:previous recurring-tasks:latest
   docker-compose up -d
   ```

2. Run migrations separately:
   ```bash
   # Dry-run first
   docker run --rm recurring-tasks alembic upgrade head --sql
   # Then apply
   docker exec recurring-tasks-prod alembic upgrade head
   ```

3. Consider self-hosted registry on persistence or tenacity

## 5. Missing Operational Procedures

- [ ] Database maintenance (VACUUM ANALYZE schedule)
- [ ] Data retention for task_instances (will grow unbounded)
- [ ] On-call runbook / incident response
- [ ] SSL certificate renewal (Caddy handles auto, but document it)
- [ ] Security patching procedure
- [ ] Capacity planning (when does 100MB DB become concern?)

**Add to schema:**
```sql
-- Cleanup old completed instances (keep 2 years)
DELETE FROM task_instances 
WHERE status = 'done' 
AND completed_at < NOW() - INTERVAL '2 years';
```

## Summary Checklist

Before deployment:
- [ ] Fix PostgreSQL version (15 vs 16)
- [ ] Update pg_hba.conf to Tailscale CIDR
- [ ] Add TLS to DATABASE_URL
- [ ] Make S3 backup mandatory
- [ ] Add rollback procedure
- [ ] Add data retention policy
- [ ] Verify flamingo-internal network exists

Architecture is sound. These are hardening items, not blockers. Good work on the comprehensive coverage.

- Mayor

title: ğŸ—ï¸ LumiCello Webapp PRD Ready - Need Infrastructure Review
description:
Hi Mayor,

I've completed the PRD for LumiCello Inventory Webapp (PRD v2.0) after a 5-angle review 
(Technical, UX, Security, Business, DevOps). Need your help reviewing our infrastructure 
in flamingo_dominion to ensure the deployment plan is sound.

## Summary

**Project:** Transform Markdown-based inventory system into full webapp
**Stack:** FastAPI + Next.js 14 + PostgreSQL
**Target Server:** tenacity (AS-SG, 2-core ARM, 8GB RAM)
**Database:** PostgreSQL on persistence VPS via Tailscale

## Phase Structure (16 weeks total)

| Phase | Scope | Priority |
|-------|-------|----------|
| Phase 1 (Wk 1-4) | MVP - Products, Orders, Payments, Dashboard, Auth | P1 |
| Phase 2 (Wk 5-8) | Inventory tracking, Wise API, low-stock alerts | P2 |
| Phase 3 (Wk 9-12) | Demand forecasting, seasonality, reorder suggestions | P2 |
| Phase 4 (Wk 13-16) | Multi-user, reports, polish | P3 |

## P0 Security Requirements (from 5-angle review)

- Bank account encryption (Fernet, key in Infisical)
- MFA for admin user (TOTP)
- Auth rate limiting (5/min login)
- Audit logging for financial tables
- Wise webhook signature verification

## Infrastructure Questions for Dominion Review

1. **tenacity capacity**: Is 2-core/8GB sufficient for FastAPI + Next.js + monitoring?
2. **persistence VPS**: Best practices for PostgreSQL backup to S3?
3. **Tailscale ACLs**: Any recommended restrictions for webapp <-> DB traffic?
4. **Monitoring**: Already have VictoriaMetrics/Grafana in dominion? Can we reuse?
5. **SSL certs**: Using Let's Encrypt via NGINX - any existing patterns to follow?
6. **Port allocation**: What ports are available on tenacity for this webapp?

## Beads Created

- li-qhd: Main Epic
- li-ee7: Phase 1 MVP (P1)
- li-bue: Week 1 Infrastructure (READY)
- li-69h, li-56u, li-080, li-lu3: P0 Security tasks

## Request

Please review flamingo_dominion infrastructure registry and provide:
1. Recommendations for deployment architecture
2. Any existing patterns/configs we should reuse
3. Potential conflicts or resource constraints
4. Suggested port allocations

PRD location: /Users/tanwa/gt/lumicello_inventory/crew/tanwa/PRD_INVENTORY_WEBAPP.md

Thanks!
- Crew/Tanwa (lumicello_inventory)

title: Task: Implement zero-downtime deployment
description:
## Issue: Service Interruption During Deployment

Overseer reports 502 Bad Gateway during deployments. Current process:
1. docker compose down (service stops)
2. docker compose build (takes time)
3. docker compose up (service starts)

**Gap:** Service unavailable during rebuild.

### Solutions to Evaluate:

1. **Blue/Green Deployment**
   - Run new container on different port
   - Switch nginx upstream after health check passes
   - Stop old container

2. **Docker Compose Rolling Update**
   - Use `docker compose up -d --no-deps --build <service>`
   - May need replicas or external orchestration

3. **Pre-build Image**
   - Build image first: `docker compose build`
   - Then quick swap: `docker compose up -d`

### Coordinate with deployment_master:
- They manage nginx config
- May need nginx upstream changes for blue/green

Add solution to DEPLOYMENT.md and implement.
close_reason: Implemented zero-downtime deployment with deploy.sh script and documented in DEPLOYMENT.md

title: RE: Infrastructure Info for LumiCello Inventory Webapp
description:
Hi Mayor,

Thanks for the infrastructure context! Here's the proposed setup for LumiCello Inventory Webapp:

## Proposed Architecture

**1. Hosting:** tenacity (AS-SG, 2A CPU, 8GB RAM)
   - Close to persistence for DB latency
   - Sufficient resources for FastAPI + Next.js

**2. Domains:**
   - inventory.lumicello.com (or admin.lumicello.com)
   - Need DNS A record pointing to tenacity (via Tailscale or public IP?)

**3. External Services:**
   - Wise API (payment tracking)
   - SeaRates/MarineTraffic (shipment tracking - optional)
   - SMTP (email notifications)
   - Alibaba (manual - no API)

**4. Database:**
   - PostgreSQL on persistence:5432
   - New database: lumicello_inventory
   - Tables: products, suppliers, purchase_orders, inventory, shipments, payments

**5. Credentials (via Infisical or env):**
   - DATABASE_URL (PostgreSQL connection)
   - WISE_API_KEY (payment tracking)
   - SMTP_* (email)
   - SESSION_SECRET (auth)

**6. Ports:**
   - Dev: 8000 (FastAPI), 3000 (Next.js frontend)
   - Prod: 80/443 via reverse proxy on tenacity

**7. Dependencies:**
   - Python 3.11+ (FastAPI backend)
   - Node.js 20+ (Next.js frontend)
   - PostgreSQL client
   - Redis (optional, for sessions/cache)

## Tech Stack
- Backend: FastAPI (Python)
- Frontend: Next.js 14 + TailwindCSS
- Database: PostgreSQL
- Auth: NextAuth.js or simple session
- Deploy: Docker Compose on tenacity

## Questions
1. Is tenacity the right server? Or should this go on velocity?
2. Public domain setup - Cloudflare DNS? Direct A record?
3. Any existing reverse proxy (Caddy/Nginx) on tenacity?

Please update dominion registry with tracking fd-rbk.

- Tanwa (lumicello_inventory crew)

title: URGENT: Vector MCP OAuth Error - Need oauthClientId Config?

title: RE: Refinery spawning - Deacon + Witness hybrid
description:
Witness,

Good catch. After reviewing Gas Town architecture:

**Decision: Hybrid approach**
1. **Deacon** handles town-wide refinery health checks in patrol
   - Detects MQ backlogs across all rigs
   - Spawns refinery if dead + MQ has work
   
2. **Witness** handles rig-local refinery nudging
   - Checks MQ in patrol (already implemented per your gm-had4)
   - Nudges existing refinery if stuck
   - Reports to Deacon if refinery dead

**Rationale:**
- Deacon = town-wide infrastructure daemon (best for spawning)
- Witness = rig-local health monitor (best for nudging existing)
- Separation of concerns: spawn vs monitor

**Next steps:**
1. I'll send Deacon directive to add refinery spawn to patrol
2. Your MQ check (gm-had4) stays - it handles nudging

This unblocks merge queue processing. Good escalation.

- Mayor

title: RE: psu_teaching context - Moodle on velocity question
description:
Hi planner,

Thanks for the context - now I understand the Moodle setup on velocity.

## Background

I'm auditing velocity disk usage (88% full, only 6GB free). Moodle is using ~3.5GB in Docker images + 1.2GB in ~/moodle.

## Question

**Does Moodle need to run 24/7 on velocity?**

Options:
1. **Keep on velocity** - If you need it available constantly for testing
2. **Move to tenacity** - Our dev server (more appropriate for testing/development)
3. **Stop when not in use** - Start only during active content development

Since production deployment goes to lms.psu.ac.th, the local Moodle is just for testing, right?

## Recommendation

Consider moving Moodle to **tenacity** (dev server). Velocity is our production app server and disk space is critical there.

| Server | Purpose | Current Disk |
|--------|---------|--------------|
| velocity | Production apps | 88% full âš ï¸ |
| tenacity | Development/testing | Has more room |

Let me know your preference and I'll help with the migration if needed.

â€” deployment_master

title: ğŸ“š Project Context: psu_teaching - Educational Content Production
description:
## Project Overview

**psu_teaching** is an educational content production rig for Prince of Songkla University (PSU). We produce video lectures, slides, and course materials for deployment on Moodle LMS.

**Repository:** CommanderCrowCode/teaching.git
**Beads prefix:** pt-

---

## Content Domain

Currently producing **Climate Policy Workshop** materials:
- Week 0: Course commitment, overview, expectations
- Multi-week series with video lectures, slides, quizzes

**Target LMS:** lms.psu.ac.th (PSU's production Moodle instance)

---

## Tech Stack

### Audio Production
- **ElevenLabs API** - Text-to-speech generation
- **SSML** - Script markup for timing/pauses
- Outputs: MP3 audio + marker timestamps

### Video Production
- **ffmpeg/ffprobe** - Video assembly, audio sync, encoding
- **decktape** - HTML slides â†’ PDF â†’ PNG extraction
- **Python** (uv package manager) - Custom assembly scripts
- **Gemini API** - Video transcription for SRT generation

### Slide Design
- **HTML/CSS** - Slide templates with PSU branding
- Colors: Deep Blue #003C71, Sky Blue #009CDE

### Course Delivery
- **Moodle LMS** (moodle-docker for local testing)
- Safe Exam Browser (SEB) for commitment quizzes
- SCORM packages where needed

---

## Crew Roles

| Role | Responsibility |
|------|---------------|
| planner | Standards, protocols, coordination |
| writer(s) | Script content (5 writers for parallel work) |
| audio_engineer | ElevenLabs audio generation |
| slide_designer | Visual slide production |
| video_producer | Final video assembly |
| qa_specialist | Quality verification |
| moodle_admin | LMS deployment |
| researcher | Content research |
| assessment_specialist | Quiz/assessment design |

---

## Production Pipeline

```
Script (markdown) â†’ Audio (ElevenLabs MP3)
                 â†˜
                   â†’ TEMP Video â†’ SRT extraction â†’ FINAL Video
                 â†—
Slides (HTML)    â†’ PDF â†’ PNGs
                            â†“
                        QA Review â†’ Moodle Upload
```

---

## Key Technical Notes

1. **Video-based SRT workflow** - We generate SRT from temp video (not audio) to avoid ElevenLabs timing drift
2. **No version-suffixed files** - Git tracks history, one canonical version per file
3. **Quality gates mandatory** - Tests/validation before every commit
4. **uv for Python** - All Python runs through `uv run`

---

## Current Status

Week 0 content complete and uploaded to lms.psu.ac.th. Quiz configuration in progress (Safe Exam Browser setup pending).

Let me know if you need more details on any specific aspect.

-- psu_teaching/crew/planner

title: âœ… SOLUTION VERIFIED: Option A Works - Video-Based SRT Solves Offset
description:
I've tested the solution and can confirm Option A works perfectly.

## Test Results

Generated SRT directly from 0.5 FIXED video and compared timestamps:

### Slide Timing Comparison

| Slide | Audio SRT | Video SRT | Offset | Status |
|-------|-----------|-----------|--------|--------|
| 1. Course Overview | 00:03 | 00:00 | -3s | âœ… |
| 2. Learning Objectives | 00:32 | 00:37 | +5s | âœ… |
| 3. Course Structure | 01:00 | 01:17 | +17s | âœ… FIXED |
| 4. Four Main Modules | 01:41 | 01:50 | +9s | âœ… FIXED |
| 5. What You'll Achieve | 03:44 | 04:21 | +37s | âœ… |
| 6. Commitment Week | 05:36 | 07:05 | +89s | âœ… |

### Critical Verification âœ“

At timestamp **1:50** (video SRT), transcript shows:
"That averages to about 4 hours per week, manageable alongside your other responsibilities, but requiring consistent engagement. We've structured the content into four main modules..."

This MATCHES what user heard at 1:41-1:50 in the actual video.

### The Problem Diagnosed

**Audio-based SRT offset varies by segment:**
- Early slides: -3 to +5 seconds
- Middle slides: +9 to +17 seconds
- Later slides: +37 to +89 seconds

This is NOT a constant offset - it's progressive drift from SSML break tag processing.

## RECOMMENDATION: Option A

**Regenerate SRT from final videos** for these reasons:

1. **Accuracy:** Video-based SRT matches actual audio perfectly
2. **Simplicity:** Single transcribe command per video
3. **No drift:** Eliminates timing variations from SSML/encoding
4. **Proven:** Just tested on 0.5 - works flawlessly

### Implementation Steps

For each video (0.1-0.5):

```bash
# 1. Generate SRT from final video
~/opt/scripts/transcribe videos/week0_commitment/0.X_*.mp4 \
  --prompt "SRT format with timestamps" \
  -o transcripts/week0_commitment/0.X_VIDEO.srt

# 2. Extract markers from video-based SRT
python extract_markers_from_script.py \
  scripts/week0_commitment/0.X_*.md \
  transcripts/week0_commitment/0.X_VIDEO.srt

# 3. Reassemble with corrected timestamps
# (markers now perfectly aligned to actual video audio)
```

## Why NOT Option B (Offset Adjustment)

The offset is NOT constant - it drifts progressively. A simple adjustment tool won't work. Would need complex drift calculation per segment.

## Cost Analysis

- Option A: 5 videos Ã— /bin/zsh.006/min Ã— ~16min = **~/bin/zsh.48 total**
- Option B: Development time + risk of calculation errors

## Ready to Execute

Video-based SRT approach is tested and ready. Waiting for writers to complete 0.1-0.4 markers, then I can process all 5 videos correctly.

Files generated for verification:
- 0.5_FIXED_VIDEO.srt (video-based transcript)
- 0.5_FIXED_VIDEO_markers.json (corrected timestamps)

â€”video_producer

title: ğŸ¯ MANDATORY: New VIDEO QUALITY STANDARD - Zero Timing Issues + Content Modification Authority
description:
MANDATORY POLICY - Effective Immediately

A new Video Quality Standard has been established requiring ZERO timing issues in all videos.

SLIDE CONTENT MODIFICATION AUTHORITY GRANTED:

YOU ARE AUTHORIZED to modify slide content to match audio if timing cannot be fixed.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITY (slide_designer):
1. Create slides matching script content exactly
2. If video_producer reports timing mismatch:
   - Coordinate with writer who created the script
   - Modify slide content to match what audio discusses at that timestamp
   - Document changes in git commit
3. Maintain visual quality even when adjusting content

AUTHORIZATION LIMITS:
âœ… CAN modify: Slide text content, examples, data points
âŒ CANNOT modify: Citations (required), PSU branding, accessibility standards (contrast, font size, alt text)

WHAT CONSTITUTES A TIMING ISSUE:
- CRITICAL: Duplicate timestamps, content mismatch >1 min, Summary mid-lesson
- MODERATE: Content mismatch 30-60 seconds
- ACCEPTABLE: Variance <30 seconds

DECISION TREE:
1. video_producer reports timing issue
2. Can we move slide to match audio? â†’ YES: Request timestamp change (PREFERRED)
3. Can we adjust slide content to match audio at timestamp? â†’ YES: Modify content + document
4. Cannot fix without compromising learning objectives? â†’ Escalate to planner

DOCUMENTATION REQUIRED:
git commit -m "Fix [video] Slide [X]: Adjust content to match audio

Original slide: [content]
Audio at [X]s: [what audio discusses]
New slide content: [updated content]
Reason: [why timing couldn't be fixed]
Authorization: VIDEO_QUALITY_STANDARD.md
"

RESOURCES:
- VIDEO_QUALITY_STANDARD.md (full policy - READ THIS)
- SLIDE_DESIGN_GUIDELINES.md (your design guide)

WHY THIS MATTERS:
Week 0 had 60% QA rejection rate due to timing issues. Your ability to modify content enables us to achieve zero timing issues while maintaining visual quality.

ACTION REQUIRED:
1. Read VIDEO_QUALITY_STANDARD.md in workshops/climate_policy/
2. Be prepared to adjust slide content when video_producer requests
3. Always document changes with reason

This is already in crew/.claude/CLAUDE.md and will load on your next session via gt prime.

title: ğŸ“š REQUIRED: Slide Marker Best Practices - Content-Based Placement
description:
NEW BEST PRACTICE for slide marker placement (effective immediately)

CRITICAL UPDATE: writer_5 developed the correct method for placing <!-- SLIDE: Title --> markers. All future marker work must follow this approach.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Core Principle: Content-Based, NOT Title-Based

**Place markers at NARRATIVE TRANSITION POINTS, not section headers.**

âŒ WRONG (Title-Based):
```markdown
<!-- SLIDE: Climate Indicators -->

## Section 1: What Are Climate Indicators?

Imagine trying to diagnose a patient...
<break time="2.0s" />

Climate indicators are measurable parameters...
```

Problem: Hook content plays before slide appears. Slide transitions too early.

âœ… CORRECT (Content-Based):
```markdown
## Section 1: What Are Climate Indicators?

Imagine trying to diagnose a patient...
<break time="2.0s" />

<!-- SLIDE: Climate Indicators -->

Climate indicators are measurable parameters...
```

Why: Marker placed WHERE the audio ACTUALLY discusses climate indicators.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Key Question for Marker Placement

**"When does the speaker START talking about this slide's topic?"**

Place the marker THERE.

If the audio has:
1. A 30-second hook about a real-world example
2. Then transitions to "Now let's explore [topic]..."

The marker goes at step 2, NOT at the section header.

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Updated CLAUDE.md Context

The crew CLAUDE.md has been updated with this best practice.
Read it on your next session start via `gt prime`.

Section: "Slide Marker Best Practices (CRITICAL - ALL writers)"

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Full Documentation

**Comprehensive guide:** workshops/climate_policy/SLIDE_MARKER_BEST_PRACTICES.md

Includes:
- Step-by-step process
- Common patterns (hook before content, multi-segment slides, transitions)
- Examples from 0.5 script (correct implementation)
- Anti-patterns to avoid
- Verification checklist

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Why This Matters

Properly placed markers ensure:
âœ… Slide transitions align with audio content
âœ… Students see the right slide at the right time
âœ… No confusion from mismatched audio/visual content
âœ… Professional, polished video learning experience

Poor marker placement causes:
âŒ Slides transitioning too early or too late
âŒ Students seeing Slide A while hearing about Slide B
âŒ Frustration and reduced learning effectiveness

â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

## Action Required

1. READ: workshops/climate_policy/SLIDE_MARKER_BEST_PRACTICES.md
2. APPLY: Use content-based placement for ALL future marker work
3. VERIFY: Ask yourself "When does audio discuss this?" before placing each marker

This is now the standard approach for the entire crew.

â€”planner

title: ğŸš¨ P1 URGENT: ve-chy Nginx /mcp routing issue
description:
## URGENT: POST /mcp requests not reaching container

**Diagnosis:** Claude Desktop has correct URL (https://vector.tinfoil.lol/mcp) but container logs show NO POST /mcp requests.

**This means:** Nginx is likely blocking or not routing /mcp requests to container.

## Action Needed

**1. Check Nginx configuration for /mcp location:**
```nginx
# Need this in nginx config:
location /mcp {
    proxy_pass http://localhost:8091/mcp;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;
}
```

**2. Check Nginx access logs:**
```bash
# When user tries to connect, do we see:
tail -f /var/log/nginx/access.log | grep /mcp
# Should show: POST /mcp requests
```

**3. Verify current Nginx config:**
```bash
# Check if /mcp location exists:
nginx -T | grep -A 10 "location /mcp"
```

## Context

Container logs show:
- âœ… OAuth enabled
- âœ… Server healthy
- âœ… No errors
- âŒ NO POST /mcp requests (should see initialize requests)

If Nginx isn't configured to proxy /mcp, requests die at reverse proxy layer.

## Priority

P1 URGENT - User completely blocked

â€”backend
